section.title: "Resources" View
section.para: In this view, the resource adaptors present in SLEE are shown, identified by their name, vendor, version and RA Type implemented. You can view the resources, their details, view and manage Resource Adaptor Entities and Links.

textobject.para: The Resources Main View, showing the existing Resource Adaptors, and the RA Type they implement.

section.title: View Resource Adaptor Details
section.para: In the Resources tab the list of Resource Adaptors is shown. When clicking on one of the resource adpators' name, its details are displayed as follows:

listitem.para: The SLEE component identifier, built from the component type, name, vendor and version.
The path to the jar containing this component, inside the deployable unit jar.
The deployable unit used to deploy this component.
The libraries this component refers, if any.
A list of the created Resource Adaptor Entities for this Resource Adaptor. These entities are clickable, and will display the Entities details.

section.title: View and Change Resource Adaptor Entities State
section.para: When the existing Resource Adaptor Entities list is shown, the Resource Adaptor Entities state is presented in the State column, it can be:

listitem.para: The resource adaptor entity has been successfully created in the SLEE. An Inactive resource adaptor entity is ready to be activated.
In this state it is possible to activate the resource adaptor entity by clicking the activate link.

The resource adaptor entity has been activated. If the SLEE is in the Running state, resource adaptor objects associated with the resource adaptor entity can create new activities, submit events on activities, and end activities. If the SLEE is in the Stopping state, resource adaptor objects associated with the resource adaptor entity cannot start new activities, but may submit events on existing activities and end activities.
In this state, it is possible to deactivate the resource adaptor entity by clicking the deactivate link.

The resource adaptor entity is being deactivated. However, some activities created by the resource adaptor objects associated with the resource adaptor entity may still exist in the SLEE and have not completed their processing. The SLEE will wait for these activities to end. Once all activities owned by resource adaptor objects of the resource adaptor entity have ended, the SLEE will transition the resource adaptor entity back to the Inactive state.
No state changing operations are available in this state, as this is a transition state, from ACTIVE to INACTIVE.

section.title: Create a Resource Adaptor Entity
section.para: In order to create a new Resource Adaptor Entity, after selecting the Resource Adaptor, fill the new entity name in the textbox next to Create entity and click the Create button. A new Entity will be created with default properties and in INACTIVE state.

section.title: Remove a Resource Adaptor Entity

important.title: Requirements to remove a Resource Adaptor Entity
important.para: To remove a Resource Adaptor Entity, there should be no Resource Adaptor Entity Links for this entity and it should be in INACTIVE state.

section.para: In order to remove a Resource Adaptor Entity, after selecting the Resource Adaptor, click the remove link. Make sure the above pre-requirements above are fulfilled.

section.title: View Resource Adaptor Entity Details
section.para: After selecting the Resource Adaptor, a list of the existent Resource Adaptor Entities can be found at the bottom of the panel. By clicking one of the Entities, the following details can be observed:

listitem.para: The current state of the Resource Adaptor Entity.
The Resource Adaptor configuration properties provide a standardized mechanism for configuration of a resource adaptor entity. The properties are Name, Type and Value.
The Resource Adaptor Entity Links provide a link to an entity, to be used by SBBs.

section.title: View and Change Resource Adaptor Entity Configuration Properties
section.para: After selecting the Resource Adaptor Entity, a list of the Resource Adaptor Entity Configuration Properties is shown. They are displayed as <name> :: <type> - <value>. Only the value can be changed.

important.title: Requirements to edit Resource Adaptor Entity Configuration Properties
important.para: To edit the Resource Adaptor Entity, if the Resource Adaptor does not support reconfiguration in ACTIVE state, it must be in INACTIVE state.

section.para: To change these values, click the Edit Properties. The values will change to an editable form. Change the values accordingly and click the Save button.

section.title: View and Change Resource Adaptor Entity Links
section.para: After selecting the Resource Adaptor Entity, a list of the Resource Adaptor Entity Links is shown. You can remove existing and add new links.

important.title: Requirements to remove a Resource Adaptor Entity Link
important.para: To remove a Resource Adaptor Entity Link, there should be no SBBs referring it.

section.para: To create a new Resource Adaptor Entity Link, fill the new link name in the Bind entity link textbox and click the Bind button.
To remove an existing Resource Adaptor Entity Link, click the unbind link.

section.title: Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters
section.para: In the Usage Parameters tab is possible to view and manage the Resource Adaptors' Entities Usage Parameters. In this screen, select a Resource Adaptor and a Resource Adaptor Entity and if a Resource Adaptor Usage Parameter Interface is defined, this view will present the default and other available Usage Parameter Sets.

textobject.para: The Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters View, showing the available usage parameters sets for a selected Resource Adaptor.

section.title: View Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters
section.para: In order to view the Usage Parameters for a given set click its name.

figure.title: Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters Details View

textobject.para: The Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters Details View, showing the usage parameters sets for a selected set from a Resource Adaptor.

listitem.para: A counter-type usage parameter can be incremented or decremented. The current (approximate) value of the counter-type usage parameter is displayed under the Value column is shown.

A sample-type usage parameter accumulates sample data, when a SLEE Component submit samples to the usage parameter. The current (approximate) minimum, maximum, mean, and the number of sample values added to the sample-type usage parameter are shown.

note.title: No automatic refresh
note.para: For performance reasons, no real-time update is performed with regards to the Usage Parameters. To update the displayed values, please click the refresh link.

section.title: Reset Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters
section.para: It is possible to reset a single Usage Parameter, when viewing the Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters list, by clicking the reset link, next to each, for Counter and Sample type usage parameters.
In order to reset all the Usage Parameters for a given Resource Adaptor, in the main Usage Parameters view, click the Reset all usage parameters button and all will be reset.

section.title: Create Named Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters Set
section.para: In addition to the default usage parameter set created by the SLEE, it is possible to create additional usage parameter sets for the same notification source, which must have a name. To create one, in the main Usage Parameters view, fill the New parameter set with the name and press the Create button and the new set will be created.

section.title: Remove Named Resource Adaptor Usage Parameters Set
section.para: To remove a created Usage Parameter Set, in the main Usage Parameters view, under the Parameter Sets list, in the Actions column, click the remove link and the set will be removed.

note.title: The "default" Usage Parameters Set cannot be removed
note.para: Only named Usage Parameters Sets can be removed, the "default" will always exist when there's a Usage Parameter Interface defined for the component.
